content.question:
​

The x axis ranges from negative 1 to 4 in increments of 1. 

The y axis ranges from negative 2 to 3 in increments of 1. 

The graph consists of four connected line segments.

Moving from left to right:

The graph begins at (negative 1 comma negative 2).

The graph continues through the origin and to the point (1 comma 2).

The graph includes the line segment from (1 comma 2) to (2 comma negative 1).

The graph includes the line segment from (2 comma negative 1) to (3 comma negative 1).

The graph includes the line segment from (3 comma negative 1 to (4 comma 0), at which it ends.

​The graph of the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is given. If <math alttext="g"><semantics><mi>g</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> is the function given by <math alttext="g open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2 x"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following is the graph of the composite function <math alttext="y equals f open parentheses g open parentheses x close parentheses close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?
